questionnaire.questionText: What is the natural texture of your hair?

answerOptions.answerText: Straight
Wavy
Curly
Coily
My hair is short (up to 3 fingers below chin)
My hair is medium (up to 4 fingers below shoulder)
My hair is long (from 4 fingers vbelow shoulder)
My hair is thin (they are usually fragile)
My hair is average (not so fragile and malleable)
My hair is thick (stiffer and strong hair)
My hair is normal (soft and shine by nature, healthy looking and easy to comb)
My hair is oily (excessive luster, thin, heavy wires without volume)
My hair is dry (parched from root to tip, rough, brittle, dull, and dizzy)
My hair is mixed (oily root with dry or normal ends, very common in long hair)

questionnaire.questionText: In the last 6 months, did you do something that damaged your hair, such as dye, discoloration, lights, straightening, relations, progressive, etc?

answerOptions.answerText: Yes, I did one or more procedures
No, I didn't do any of that

questionnaire.questionText: How many times a week do you use thermal appliances such as hair dryer or flat iron

answerOptions.answerText: Never or less than once a week
1 or 2 times a week
3 or 4 times a week
5 or more times a week

questionnaire.questionText: Select all options that apply to the CURRENT state of your hair:

answerOptions.answerText: Embarrassed when wet, armed, dull or with split ends
Frizzy, dry, or scruffy
it is thin (whin few wires)
Two of this
Thre of this
None of this

questionnaire.questionText: Take a strand of hair from the top of your head, wrap it around your fingers (like a floss) and pull until the hair breaks. What happens?

answerOptions.answerText: Break by applying just a little force
It looks strong and doesn't break easily

questionnaire.questionText: Take another strand of hair and flick it quickly between your fingers, applying pressure, as if stretching a satin ribbon or pulling a thread to find its tip. Doing so will cause your hair to curl more than usual (if not, apply more pressure or pull harder). Then , stretch the wire a little force for a few seconds and release it. If it returns to its original shape, it is elastic, if it remains curled, it is rigid.

answerOptions.answerText: Does not return to normal state, remaining coiled
Returns to normal after test

questionnaire.questionText: Take a glass or bowl of water and put a few strand of your hair over the water without sinking. Do no touch them for 3 minutes.

answerOptions.answerText: Most of the hair floats
The hair is + or - in the middle
the hair hits the bottom
